title: Chic - The Best Of Vol.1 & 2@320
description:
CHIC

To the rock critics who dismissed Chic&#039;s music as disposable and mindless back in the late &#039;70s: it might seem like a stretch to say that Nile Rodgers and Bernard Edwards had as great an impact as Gamble & Huff, George Clinton, and the folks at Stax Records. But in fact, Chic&#039;s music was that influential -- and its disco/funk/soul innovations would be having an impact long after the &#039;70s ended. From Madonna, Change, and Queen, to Duran Duran, Soul II Soul, and ABC -- new wave, hip-hop, house, European Hi-NRG, Latin freestyle, and acid jazz -- you could write a book about all the artists who have been influenced by Chic. (AMG)



PERSONNEL
Bernard Edwards (vocals, bass); Alfa Anderson, Luci Martin (vocals); Nile Rodgers (guitar); Tony Thompson (drums).



1. Chic - Dance, Dance, Dance (The Best Of)

You think disco was nothing more than assembly line funk and freeze-dried beats? Then you need to step into the crisp grooves and walloping boogie found on this stunning collection of Chic&#039;s &#039;70s recordings. Such hits as "Good Times," "Dance Dance Dance," and "Le Freak" used the stylistic innovations of James Brown and Sly Stone as a blueprint for a new era of funk. Bernard Edwards&#039; basslines are so provocative they seem to talk, while Nile Rodgers&#039; skeletal guitar runs hark back to Steve Cropper&#039;s slashing style. Sure, the songs don&#039;t say much. Sure, the dance mixes collected here ramble on after about six minutes. But once you step into these grooves -- grooves that influenced an entire generation of artists from David Byrne to Prince -- you will realize that these were indeed good times. (AMG)


01. Dance, Dance, Dance (Yowsah, Yowsah, Yowsah)

11. Savoir Faire        

Label: Atlantic
Date: 1991



2. Chic - The Best Of Vol.2

Filling out the gaps left by the first volume, The Best of Chic, Vol. 2 proves with its collection of album tracks and singles that Chic was not merely a great disco band, but was a great band, period. (AMG)
